study tip one pay attention to the whole
context you can often guess the meaning
of a new expression by listening to the
whole conversation let's try doing this
with our first expression dr. Chen

study tip - try using at least two
different sources to get a clear
understanding of a new expression
sources may be dictionaries textbooks or
other English speakers
let's try applying this tip Susan do you
know the expression to bite off more
than you can chew yes I do how do you
understand that expression what does it
mean it means when you sometimes take on
something more than you think you're

get through it and do it thank you
did you listen closely to the

work it would be more accurate to say
this idiom is about having too much work

oh definitely and I was overwhelmed I

Yeah right as you go definitely and

isn't another expression related to
teeth is like pulling teeth do you know

like well I have two sons and sometimes
when you want to get information out of

up it's it's sometimes tough so you feel
like you're pulling teeth to get that
information out of them
yes sometimes when I talk to my younger
siblings I ask them how their day was
and they'll just think good and won't
collaborate on anything that happened so
it's very hard to get answers from them
it's like pulling teeth did you pay
attention to the whole context did you
listen closely to the explanation for
the expression like pulling teeth so
what do you understand now
does this idiom refer to something being
painful or something being difficult
something being difficult correct let's
review our three expressions are three
idioms about teeth if you have a sweet
tooth you have a love for sweet foods
foods with lots of sugar if you bite off
more than you can chew you take on more
than you can handle
you could be taking on too much work or
you could be facing too big of a
challenge if getting someone to do
something is like pulling teeth
it's very difficult it's hard to get
that person to agree to do what you want
usually it's a matter of getting
information getting that person to
provide answers or details exercise one
choose the correct description of the
situation one it's not easy to have a
conversation with Jerry he usually gives
short responses to my questions and they
get the feeling that he doesn't really
want to share anything personal with
anyone at work which is the correct
description of the situation a Jerry
doesn't have a sweet tooth or be talking
to Jerry is like pulling teeth
answer b2 on my sister's birthday I
usually buy her something special from
the bakery these kinds of treats make
her happy on any day of the year
which description is the correct one a
my sister has a sweet tooth or B my
sister bites off more than she can chew
answer a3 the detective questioned the
suspect for over an hour but he could
not get the suspect to give any useful
information which is the correct

answer a for Adams problem is that he
can't say no he tries to meet every
request made and then he goes crazy
trying to get everything done on time
which is the correct description a Adam

what do you like to eat
